Contradict fact: The claim that hand sanitizer will do nothing for the coronavirus contradicts the fact that hand sanitizers with 60% alcohol can be used to help prevent contracting and spreading the virus, as stated by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
Understate: The claim underestimates the effectiveness of hand sanitizers in preventing the spread of the coronavirus.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up its assertion that hand sanitizer is ineffective against the coronavirus.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that hand sanitizer, being anti-bacterial, cannot work against a virus like the coronavirus. However, experts have explained that hand sanitizers with alcohol can effectively disrupt the envelope of viral particles, including coronaviruses.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation provided by experts that hand sanitizers, when used properly, complement proper hand-washing with soap and water in preventing the spread of COVID-19.
